decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provide early pressure, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride offer additional ways to boost damage output. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Ranger-Captain of Eos to control the board. Arena of Glory helps to pump up the team, ensuring consistent aggression. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through fast and efficient damage, leveraging its creature and burn spells to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling multiple land combos to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. With cards like Amulet of Vigor and multiple land bounce lands, it can enable explosive plays that allow for massive ramp and efficient mana usage. The deck also incorporates spells like Scapeshift and Explore to further accelerate the land base and set up for game-winning combos involving cards like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. Overall, the deck relies on a unique synergy between lands and creatures to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on pumping out aggressive creatures and dealing early damage to the opponent. It utilizes powerful cards like Ajani, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Ragavan to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison adds additional versatility and disruption to control the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to allow for consistent access to the necessary colors while also providing the flexibility to adjust to different matchups. Overall, this deck is designed to be fast, efficient, and punishing to opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces. The inclusion of fallaji archaeologist and emperor of bones provide additional reanimation options. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and secure a win.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to generate mana and enable powerful synergies with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga. It aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Thought Monitor, while also disrupting their strategies with cards like Pithing Needle and Tormod's Crypt. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Lavaspur Boots provide additional utility and evasion, allowing the deck to quickly close out games with a combination of beatdown and disruption.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays while also disrupting the opponent's strategies with cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Relic of Progenitus. The main goal is to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Ephemerate, while also utilizing cards like Solitude and Flickerwisp for tempo plays. The deck also includes hand disruption with Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while still being able to cast the necessary spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficiently costed creatures. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus, while deploying threats such as Solitude and Emperor of Bones. By combining disruptive elements with a resilient creature base, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp for added versatility and value.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays with powerful 4/5c aggro creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco. It also utilizes efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding to control the board. The combination of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provides additional protection and power boost for creatures. The mana base is diverse to support the multicolor spells, ensuring consistency in casting powerful threats and burn spells. Overall, the strategy revolves around early aggression and maintaining board presence to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on combining the graveyard recursion ability of Underworld Breach with artifact mana and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to loop through spells and triggers to win the game through either Grapeshot or Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch serves as additional recursion to keep the combo going, while Urza's Saga helps tutor for key pieces. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Lightning Bolt and Pithing Needle to control the game until the combo can be assembled and executed.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard by sacrificing artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Grinding Station to generate mana and trigger Emry, Lurker of the Loch's ability. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces while cards like Malevolent Rumble provide disruption. The deck aims to win by milling the opponent out with Thassa's Oracle or dealing direct damage with Lightning Bolt. Urza's Saga and the Moxen provide additional mana acceleration to set up the combo quickly.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. By using cards like Kozilek's Command and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's strategy, combined with aggressive creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Sire of Seven Deaths, this deck aims to close out games quickly. Trinisphere and All Is Dust provide additional disruption and board control, while also allowing the deck to stay ahead in the mid to late game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Talisman of Impulse and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to deal with opponents' threats. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large, hard-to-answer threats while also having the ability to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disruption, removal, and card advantage. It seeks to control the game through counterspells like Counterspell, removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, and disruption tools like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation. The deck also utilizes creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Abhorrent Oculus for additional threats and ways to pressure the opponent. By constantly disrupting the opponent's game plan, removing threats, and drawing cards, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent to eventually control the game and win.

The main focus is to quickly dump multiple cards into the graveyard, allowing for easy casting of powerful creatures like Hollow One and Vengevine. The deck aims to aggressively attack the opponent with fast creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Detective's Phoenix and Marauding Mako. The combination of card draw and discard effects such as Burning Inquiry and Faithless Looting help to fuel the deck's strategy of overwhelming the opponent with early threats and constant pressure.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt opponent's strategy by taxing their resources while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Key cards like Solitude and Fatal Push help control the board, while creatures like Boggart Trawler and Ketramose, the New Dawn deal damage quickly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Relic of Progenitus and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponent's plans. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also allowing for solid mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to overpower opponents quickly while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and versatile spells to apply early pressure and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, as well as powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total before they can establish a strong board presence. Additionally, cards like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help to control the board and protect your creatures, while lands like Arid Mesa and Wooded Foothills ensure consistent mana base for casting spells.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly by utilizing cards such as Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer to get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield as soon as possible. Once Primeval Titan is in play, it can search for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva to set up explosive combo turns with cards like Scapeshift. By efficiently tutoring for the right lands and utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Urza's Saga, the deck can consistently assemble its combos and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, along with powerful anthems like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck is able to apply pressure early in the game and maintain it through the mid to late game. Ranger-Captain of Eos helps tutor for key creatures, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison provide additional reach and disruption. The deck is finely tuned to be proactive and aggressive in order to quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach in combination with various artifacts and graveyard manipulation to continuously loop spells and artifacts, creating a powerful combo engine. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student are key pieces for card advantage and recursion. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly to win the game through either milling the opponent with Grinding Station, utilizing Thassa's Oracle, or dealing direct damage with Malevolent Rumble. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and resources to support the combo.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to repeatedly mill cards, generate mana, and cast spells from the graveyard using Underworld Breach. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student serve as key pieces in this strategy, while also providing card advantage. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal helps to ramp up mana quickly. The deck also includes disruption spells like Lightning Bolt and Swan Song to protect the combo. Breeding Pool and various fetch lands provide color fixing and synergy with Urza's Saga for additional value.

The deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to put pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck includes efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with plenty of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to deal direct damage. The goal is to maintain a fast pace and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. The deck focuses on stopping threats with cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Pact of Negation, while also utilizing creatures like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus to apply pressure and control the board. By utilizing a mix of disruption and threats, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and slowly grind out a win through card advantage and strong board presence.

The deck revolves around an explosive combo utilizing Glimpse of Tomorrow to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Omnath, Locus of Creation. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Risen Reef provide additional synergy and value, while Omniscience allows for casting spells for free. The strategy focuses on ramping into big threats quickly while controlling the board with cards like Solitude. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo of Colossus Hammer onto a creature, typically Memnite or Ornithopter, and then use Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic to equip it for free. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a massive, evasive threat. Additionally, cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Urza's Saga provide disruption and additional consistency to the deck. The inclusion of Leyline Axe and other equipment allows for flexibility in combat and evasion. The deck focuses on explosive, aggressive plays to quickly win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly getting big creatures into play by utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance. These creatures have powerful effects that can disrupt the opponent's game plan or generate card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like hand disruption and removal spells to control the game until it can execute its combo. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy and ensure the right colors of mana are available when needed.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through various removal spells and countermagic. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Strict Proctor and Orim's Chant. Additionally, the deck includes cards that can generate card advantage and provide card selection to maintain a steady stream of threats and answers. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury serves as a win condition, dealing massive damage to the opponent. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its three-color requirements and provide consistent access to its powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to use a combination of cheap spells, counterspells, and card draw to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game without relying on traditional land cards. Thundertrap Trainer, Fallaji Archaeologist, and Hydroelectric Specimen are used to generate mana and draw cards, while Tameshi, Reality Architect is the win condition of the deck. By using spells like Whir of Invention and Jwari Disruption to search for key pieces and protect the combo, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

The deck focuses on utilizing Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By leveraging lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, along with tribal synergies and disruption spells like Tide Shaper and Flare of Denial, it aims to establish board presence and tempo advantage. The inclusion of Aether Vial enables the deck to deploy creatures quickly and efficiently, while cards like Sink into Stupor provide additional disruption. The land base includes utility lands like Mutavault and Cavern of Souls to support the aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's game plan while also building your own board presence. With a mix of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, you aim to constantly apply pressure and control the game. Utilizing flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to repeatedly trigger enter-the-battlefield effects and disrupt your opponent's strategy, this deck combines aggression and disruption to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures and spells, while also applying pressure with efficient threats. By utilizing cards like Solitude for removal, Ephemerate for tempo advantage, and cards like Emperor of Bones and Ketramose for aggressive plays, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of creature disruption, hand disruption, and removal, this Death and Taxes deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's plans while applying its own pressure to come out ahead in the game.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Renegade Rallier to search for key creatures and Ephemerate to provide additional value, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful cards like Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines and Eternal Witness provides the deck with late-game staying power. Overall, the deck seeks to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
